thread.title: Globetrotters request Great Assist nominations before arrival
thread.title_full: Globetrotters request Great Assist nominations before arrival

author: WILLIAM KERNS A-J MEDIA ENTERTAINMENT EDITOR
title: Globetrotters request Great Assist nominations before arrival
text:
Globetrotters request Great Assist nominations before arrival Harlem Globetrotters again show off scoring, ball handling skills Posted: October 8, 2015 - 10:16pm | Updated: October 9, 2015 - 12:00am By WILLIAM KERNS A-J MEDIA ENTERTAINMENT EDITOR 
The world famous Harlem Globetrotters will make another stop in Lubbock at 7 p.m. Feb. 9 at United Supermarkets Arena, 1701 indiana Ave. 
The team will celebrate the Globetrotters’ 90th-anniversary world tour, promising a star-studded roster, ball handling wizardry, basketball artistry and one-of-a-kind family entertainment. Players include Big Easy Lofton, Ant Atkinson, Hi-Lite Bruton, Thunder Law, Bull Bullard, Cheese Chisholm and female Globetrotters TNT Maddox and Sweet J Ekworomadu. 
The Globetrotters have a 2016 program called The Great Assist, which will find the team leaving its mark in communities with acts of kindness and good will. 
Fans are encouraged to visit GreatAssist.com to nominate a worthwhile cause or a deserving family in need of a smile, and the Globetrotters will help as many fans as possible. 
In addition to fan requests, the team plans to bring its bullying prevention program to more than 400 schools and community centers, talk to youth about character education and physical fitness, visit children’s hospitals and lend a hand to those in need. 
Reserved seats are $44.25, $36 and $29.75, with a limited number of $96.75 courtside tickets and $290.50 VIP bench seats also available. All prices include service charges. 
Tickets will be sold at the Select-A-Seat outlets at Amigo’s Supermarket, Dollar Western Wear, Lubbock Memorial Civic Center, Market Street, Ralph’s Records, Texas Tech Student Union’s ticket booth and United Supermarkets. 
Call 770-2000 for more details. 
william.kerns@lubbockonline.com
